Identification.ShortTitle: Commercial Loan (Trust and Loan Companies) Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Defining Certain Expressions and Prescribing Certain International Agencies in Respect of Commercial Loans

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to the definition commercial loan in subsection 449(1) and sections 461 to 463 and 531 of the Trust and Loan Companies Act*, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations defining certain expressions and prescribing certain international agencies in respect of commercial loans.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Commercial Loan (Trust and Loan Companies) Regulations.
In these Regulations, Act means the Trust and Loan Companies Act. (Loi)
For the purpose of sections 461 and 462 of the Act, the prescribed subsidiaries of a company are all of the subsidiaries of the company.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of the definition commercial loan in subsection 449(1) of the Act, widely distributed means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of debt obligations the distribution of which is exempt from the requirement to file a prospectus under the laws of Canada, a province or a jurisdiction outside Canada, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 90% of the maximum authorized principal of the debt obligations is held by one or more persons other than the company and its subsidiaries, and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the debt obligations were issued to at least 25 persons other than the company and its subsidiaries within six months after the day on which the first of the debt obligations was issued, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if the debt obligations are issued on a continuous basis, there are on average at least 25 holders other than the company and its subsidiaries, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: at the time of their initial distribution, the debt obligations met at least three of the following criteria:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their initial term was less than one year,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: they were rated by a rating agency,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: they were distributed through a person authorized to trade in securities, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: they were distributed in accordance with an offering circular or memorandum, or a similar document relating to the distribution of securities; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any other securities, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are listed and posted for trading on a recognized stock exchange, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prospectus relating to the issuance of the securities was filed under the laws of Canada, a province or a jurisdiction outside Canada.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(a)(i), maximum authorized principal means, in relation to any debt obligation, the maximum amount of debt that may be issued under the terms of the debt obligation or any agreement relating to it.

Section.Text: For the purposes of the definition commercial loan in subsection 449(1) of the Act, the prescribed international agencies are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Council of Europe Development Bank.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 461 and 462 of the Act, total assets, in respect of a company, at a particular time, means the total of the assets that would be reported on the balance sheet of the company prepared as at that time in accordance with the accounting principles and specifications of the Superintendent referred to in subsection 313(4) of the Act.
